Description: 2 beads made of different materials and in different shapes. A: Cylindrical segmented bead made of a light green turquoise faience, the glaze covers only parts of the bead. One end broken off. B: Half of a spherical bead, broken along the perforation made of glass of different colour. The middle part is whitish with a light pink band, at both ends bluish turquoise bands, all these bands are circumferential. In addition at both ends very thin filaments of glass running slightly askew across the other bands.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Amara West (Nubia), D15.R.11, Mound β
Acquisition notes: Formerly housed by the Birmingham Museum and Art Gallery and the EES London.
